item.title: How to Unlock the FIBA Tournament in NBA 2K26
item.description:
Once you've established a foothold in the NBA in NBA 2K26 MyCareer, you'll move on to other projects off the court to help develop your brand while earning VC along the way. One NBA 2K26 MyCareer quest requires you to play in the FIBA Tournament, but you can only access it after reaching a certain milestone in your career.

The FIBA tournament is an offseason activity that gives you the chance to team up with other NBA players to take on teams from around the world. You'll have to play FIBA games to complete Merchandising Tier 7, and it's also a requirement for MyPlayer Endorsement objectives. You'll earn thousands of VC if you can make it to the FIBA Tournament, so it's worth the wait.

How to Play in a FIBA Tournament in NBA 2K26

FIBA games are exclusively available during the offseason in NBA 2K26 . After your first professional season in the NBA, you'll have the chance to play your first FIBA game. The FIBA Tournament will happen after you complete your second NBA season , so there are quite a few games ahead of you.

Once you've completed your second NBA season, you'll find the FIBA games in the MyCareer tab of the menu with other offseason activities. Just choose to play your next game, and it'll start a FIBA match for you. You can choose any opponent you want if it's not a tournament year, but the FIBA tournament bracket after your second season is determined ahead of time.

FIBA matches gather some of the best basketball talent from around the globe, so make sure you're prepared with upgraded attributes and Takeovers. You have t o win the FIBA Tournament or any three FIBA games in order to complete Merchandising Tier 7 , so losing isn't an option unless you want to sit through a whole other NBA season waiting for the chance to play FIBA games again.

If you win your FIBA games, you'll take home several thousand VC that you can use to upgrade your player's attributes, buy new clothing items, or rip open some packs in MyTeam. It's a long grind to reach that point, but you'll also earn REP, VC, and other rewards as you play key NBA games and complete quests in the City.

item.title: Technical Limitations Helped Make These Games Great
item.description:
Summary

  • Video game hardware advancements have led to more creative freedom but also the creation of a template for maximum sales.
  • Technical limitations in the past resulted in creative solutions and iconic aspects in games like Silent Hill and Metal Gear.
  • Games like Grand Theft Auto and Space Invaders turned technical limitations into gameplay features, shaping their respective franchises.

With video game hardware being more advanced than ever before, developers don't need to deal with the same restrictions that held them down in the past. While this should've ideally allowed for more creative freedom and expression in games, it has also led to the creation of a template of sorts to sell as many games as possible to make up for the increased cost of video game development.

This might not be true in the case of every video game, but fans can't deny that titles in the past were way more creative and experimental. Even if developers had to deal with technical limitations, the solutions they devised were so iconic that they heightened the quality of these games in the eyes of many.

1 Silent Hill

The Fog Was Used to Hide the Game's Poor Draw Distance

Silent Hill
8.0 /10
Released
January 31, 1999

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Konami
Publisher(s)
Konami
Platform(s)
PS1
Powered by

Silent Hill 's development makes for a fascinating tale, especially once players find out that Konami genuinely struggled with the game's draw distance. To combat this, they decided to drench the town of Silent Hill in fog to cover up what they felt to be a flaw.

Instead, this fog enhanced the town's atmosphere considerably, ensuring players feel a steady sense of dread while exploring the town and everything it had to offer. It's one of the most iconic aspects of Silent Hill that has been carried forward in every single Silent Hill game ever since.

2 Grand Theft Auto

A Bug That Caused the Police to Be Too Aggressive Shaped This Franchise's Future

6 Images
6 Images
Grand Theft Auto
6.5 /10
Released
November 28, 1997

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Rockstar North
Publisher(s)
BMG Interactive
Platform(s)
PC, PS1, Nintendo Game Boy Color
Powered by

Grand Theft Auto started out as an illegal street racing game, only for a bug to cause cops to run players over. While the developers could've struggled to deal with this technical hitch, what they stumbled upon was something far more magical.

The aggressive cops were so fun to interact with that the Grand Theft Auto series was born, with Rockstar allowing players to enjoy a crime-fueled tirade for the ages. The iconic Wanted system of the franchise would've never come into being had it not been for this happy accident.

3 Metal Gear

Originally Designed as an Action Game, but Hardware Limitations Turned It Into a Stealth Game With Few Enemies

3 Images
3 Images
Metal Gear
Action
Stealth
Systems
Released
July 13, 1987

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Konami
Publisher(s)
Konami
Platform(s)
PC, Commodore 64, Nintendo Entertainment System, Nintendo GameCube, MS-DOS, MSX2
Powered by

When the first Metal Gear game was being made, Kojima faced an issue regarding its development. The MSX2 simply wasn't powerful enough to render too many enemies on the screen at once, which made the game's action fall flat.

To combat this, Kojima decided to make the game stealth-oriented, making for one of the first video games in this genre. The legacy of this title speaks for itself, setting the groundwork for the Metal Gear Solid franchise to take over the mainstream.

4 System Shock 2

Programming NPCs Was Too Much Work, Contributing to the Game's Desolate, Isolating Atmosphere

6 Images
6 Images
System Shock 2
2.0 /10
Released
August 11, 1999

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Irrational Games, Looking Glass Technologies, NightDive Studios
Publisher(s)
Electronic Arts, NightDive Studios
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

System Shock 2 's oppressive atmosphere may seem like an intentional choice, but there was a time when the player was supposed to meet friendly NPCs on the Von Braun. However, technical limitations prevented the game from adding these characters to the game.

So, any other humans aside from the player were removed, and players were left all alone as they dealt with the threats aboard the Von Braun. It enhances the already fantastic atmosphere of System Shock 2 , which went on to become one of the greatest immersive sim RPGs of all time.

5 Spider-Man (2000)

The Fog Covering the Ground Was Used to Hide the Fact That Developers Couldn't Render the Ground

3 Images
3 Images
Spider-Man
Action-Adventure
Systems
7.5 /10
Released
September 1, 2000
ESRB
E // Animated Violence

Developer(s)
Neversoft
Publisher(s)
Activision
Platform(s)
PS1, N64, Sega Dreamcast, PC, Nintendo Game Boy Color
Powered by

The original Spider-Man is one of the most nostalgic video games for many fans. Peter Parker's epic adventures elicit the magic of the comic books as Spidey takes on a whole host of iconic villains.

During the time this game was developed, rendering the ground was a challenge for Neversoft, which is why they used the poison fog as an excuse to work around this technical solution. What could've been a crude solution ended up being a great way to force players on rooftops as they tried to save New York City.

6 Okami

Making the Game Photorealistic Was too Much Work, so the Choice Was Made for Cel-Shaded Graphics

5 Images
5 Images
Okami
8.3 /10
Released
September 19, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Capcom, Clover Studio
Publisher(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, PS2, Xbox One, Switch, Wii, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Okami may not have sold too many units at launch, but it eventually became a cult classic and is finally receiving a sequel. A huge reason why this game became all the rage is because of its Zelda -like charm and because of its cel-shaded art style (that was genuinely breathtaking to look at).

This strong art design is something that could've been lost early on, since the developers intended for a photorealistic approach to the graphics. However, this turned out to be a huge hurdle, which is why the iconic cel shading was chosen for this magical adventure.

7 Space Invaders

Accidentally Added a Difficulty Progression Curve as the Enemies Moved Faster With Less of Them On-Screen

Space Invaders
Action
Shooter
Systems
Released
April 1, 1978
ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Taito

Publisher(s)
Taito, Midway Games, Atari
Platform(s)
Arcade, Atari 400, Atari 800, Atari 2600, Atari 5200, Nintendo Game Boy, PC, Nintendo Entertainment System, WonderSwan
Powered by

Space Invaders is one of the earliest video game successes that made waves on arcade cabinets. It also turned a technical limitation into a seamless integration of a difficulty curve.

With more enemies on screen, machines couldn't run the game at full speed. However, as the number of foes displayed on screen reduced, less processing power was used, and the game sped up. This had the unintended effect of making the game harder as players defeated more enemies and turned Space Invaders into a legendary video game that fans still love.

8 Donkey Kong

Mario's Iconic Design Stemmed From the Graphical Limitations of the Time

3 Images
3 Images
Donkey Kong
Arcade
Systems
8.7 /10
Released
July 31, 1981
ESRB
e

Developer(s)
Nintendo R&D1, Ikegami Tsushinki
Publisher(s)
Nintendo
Platform(s)
Arcade, Atari 2600, Nintendo Entertainment System, Commodore 64, Nintendo Game Boy Advance
Powered by

Donkey Kong is one of the most legendary video games of all time that served as the debut of gaming's most iconic character, Mario. His early character design featured the iconic moustache, red cap, and overalls that have become synonymous with this character.

These bright colors were chosen for the character because there simply weren't enough pixels at the time to make for complex character designs. Mario needed to be an eye-catching character despite these limited resources, leading to the first draft of what would become one of the most beloved video game characters of all time.

item.title: How to Get the Shaman Crest in Hollow Knight Silksong
item.description:
There are seven crests in Hollow Knight: Silksong , although only six of these can be acquired during the game's first two acts. The last and arguably best of Silksong 's seven crests, the Shaman Crest , can only be acquired in Act 3, and only after players have acquired the Silk Soar ability down in the depths of The Abyss.

The thing that makes the Shaman Crest so ridiculously overpowered is that it allows Silksong players to equip three different Silk Skills at a time, helping them to tear through bosses like a hot knife through butter. When paired with blue tools like the Volt Filament , the Shaman Crest becomes even more deadly.

How to Get the Shaman Crest in Hollow Knight: Silksong

As mentioned above, players will need to have unlocked Hornet's Silk Soar ability before they can get the Shaman Crest. Assuming they've already done so, they should head on over to the Bone Bottom Bellway and then make their way to the left until they come to the hole with the ray of light shining down on it. Once there, they can drop down and head inside the doorway to the Ruined Chapel on their left.

Once inside the Ruined Chapel, players should head to the far right and stand in front of the lore marker , then use Silk Soar by holding down together with the harpoon button (S on PC, L2 on PlayStation, LT on Xbox, or L on Switch). This will propel Hornet through the ceiling above her, allowing her to carry on to the right . From here, it's a simple case of following the path, while being sure to destroy the three breakable walls using slash attacks along the way.

Eventually, players will drop down into an area with a destroyed statue . Standing in front of this will allow them to hold down to claim , after which, they'll then just need to tap the Bind button a few times to unlock the Shaman Crest . To begin with, it only has three white slots unlocked, but by using a couple of Memory Lockets, players can unlock two blue slots. If they haven't already done so, they can add a yellow slot and one additional blue slot by getting the two Vesticrests from Eva in Weavenest Atla.

item.title: IShowSpeed Fortnite Collab Seemingly Leaked by Kai Cenat
item.description:
IShowSpeed could finally be coming to Fortnite , according to information accidentally leaked on stream by Kai Cenat. Several celebrities have become part of the roster of skins available in Fortnite . It all started with the Marshmello skin; he was the first one to be part of the Icon Series back in Chapter 1, and it has been growing ever since. From renowned artists, like Lady Gaga and Metallica, to streamers known all across the globe, such as SypherPK and Ninja, the Icon Series features an eclectic group of people.

The next known Icon Series collab is being added to Fortnite with the release of patch v37.20. Fortnite revealed that the Kai Cenat skin would be coming to the game with a huge announcement on the Sphere in Las Vegas on August 19. On Friday, September 12, players will be able to purchase the Kai Cenat skin alongside the rest of his cosmetic set once the Item Shop rotates at 8 PM ET.

Kai Cenat Shows Discord Chat Named "IShowSpeed x Fortnite Collab"

It seems that Kai Cenat may not be the only streamer making it into Fortnite in the near future. On September 9, while streaming, Kai Cenat opened Discord and went through some of his direct messages. While doing this, he apparently failed to notice that he had a group chat right at the top titled "IShowSpeed x Fortnite Collab," leading fans to believe that Fortnite and IShowSpeed could be working together to create a cosmetic set of the latter.

Of course, this could just be a group chat with a random name. When the Kai Cenat skin was announced, many fans commented on how much they wanted an IShowSpeed skin as well. This could've been Cenat's friends setting this up to tease him. However, it is also entirely possible that it is true; Kai Cenat could be helping the developers come up with a cosmetic set for Speed. It would make sense for Fortnite to collaborate with IShowSpeed, especially if the Kai Cenat collab does well, as the two are tight friends and share many members of their audience.

IShowSpeed is one of the most well-known streamers in the world, and surely many Fortnite players enjoy his content, as he has played the game on stream before, including with Kai Cenat. If the rumors turn out to be true, it's possible that the two skins could come out together, with IShowSpeed's skin released as a surprise to fans. Players who are curious to know more about this should keep an eye on upcoming leaks for v37.20 on September 10 and v37.30 on September 16.

Create, play, and battle with friends for free in Fortnite. Be the last player standing in Battle Royale and Zero Build, experience a concert or live event, or discover over a million creator made games, including racing, parkour, zombie survival, and more. Each Fortnite island has an individual age rating so you can find the one that's right for you and your friends.

Explore large, destructible environments where no two games are ever the same. Team up with friends by sprinting, climbing and smashing your way to earn your Victory Royale, whether you choose to build up in Fortnite Battle Royale or go no-builds in Fortnite Zero Build.

Discover even more ways to play across thousands of creator-made game genres: adventure, roleplay, survival and more. Or, band together with up to three friends to fend off hordes of monsters in Save the World.

item.title: Most Addictive Grand Strategy Games
item.description:
Summary

  • Grand strategy games offer addictive experiences with managing economies, waging wars, and forming alliances.
  • Players can enjoy mastering complex gameplay loops and becoming superpowers in historical or fictional settings.
  • Games like Victoria 3, Endless Legend, and Stellaris provide engaging experiences with diverse factions and in-depth gameplay.

Grand strategy games are meant to be addictive experiences that players can enjoy for hours on end. Managing economies, waging wars, and forming alliances are just a few of the many ways fans can lose themselves in these massive titles without even realizing how much time is passing in the real world.

Once players get past the initial learning curve, mastering these games makes for a great time as players do everything in their power to become a superpower. From grand strategy games set during real-world time periods to ones that delve into the realm of fiction, these games are a blast to play as players become enamored with their gameplay loops.

Victoria 3

Overcame A Rocky Launch To Become A Great Game

Victoria 3
7.7 /10
Released
October 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Mild Blood, Mild Suggestive Themes, Mild Violence, Partial Nudity, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Victoria 3 had a difficult launch, with fans lamenting the lack of content in this title. Thankfully, like most other Paradox Interactive games, it took a few years and many updates to let fans enjoy a ton of things to do in this title, which takes place during the Victorian Era.

Helping a nation's economy prosper, forming alliances, dealing with potential wars, and interacting with the many gameplay pillars of this title never ceases to be engaging. Players fascinated by this historical era will love reshaping the world in their image in Victoria 3 .

Endless Legend

Diverse Factions And Civ-esque Gameplay

Endless Legend
4X
Strategy
Systems
Released
September 18, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Endless Legend is perfect for players who want to enjoy a game like Civilization with a fantasy twist. The unique factions of this title ensure that every playthrough feels different. With a whopping fourteen factions to choose from, players will never get bored with this amazing grand strategy game. Hopefully, Endless Legend 2 will continue this title's legacy and draw more eyes toward the franchise.

Hearts Of Iron 3

Arguably More Complex And Engaging Than Its Successor

Hearts of Iron III
Strategy
Systems
Released
August 7, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Everyone 10+ // Mild Violence
Powered by

While Hearts of Iron 4 may be the more modern experience, giving out loose tactical instructions and relying on the AI to secure a victory can make for a frustrating affair. This is why players loved Hearts of Iron 3 , since it gave players more control over the developments on the battlefield.

Getting into this title can be challenging, but players who don't mind the learning curve will eventually grow to love the tactical brilliance of Hearts of Iron 3 . Ensuring that history isn't altered in World War 2 or trying to change the course of history are both fun ways to play this military grand strategy game.

Total War: Warhammer 2

Arguably The Best Total War Game Ever Made

5 Images
5 Images
Total War: Warhammer 2
9.0 /10
Released
September 28, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

The Total War games have always been focused on real-world scenarios, which is why the collaboration with Warhammer came as a pleasant surprise to fans. The first game showed a ton of promise that was more than fulfilled in Total War: Warhammer 2 .

Players will find it hard to tear themselves away from the screen as they get invested in the game's excellent battles and fun grand strategy elements. The fact that most people consider Total War: Warhammer 2 to be one of the series' best games speaks volumes when it comes to the excellence of this video game.

Europa Universalis 4

Riveting Gameplay Will Keep Players Occupied For Hours On End

Europa Universalis 4
8 /10
8.7 /10
Released
August 13, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Drug Reference, Mild Language, Mild Sexual Themes, Mild Violence
Powered by

To this day, there's something about Europa Universalis 4 that makes it impossible for gamers to put down. The geopolitical conflicts are incredible to play around with as the world transitions to modern times and several superpowers stake their claim.

Colonizing territories, managing the nation's economy, and engaging in the tactful art of diplomacy are all a huge part of what makes Europa Universalis 4 so special. Players will see the hours fly by as they control the nation of their choice and help it become more dominant than ever.

Stellaris

This Sci-fi Grand Strategy Game Is A Blast To Play

Stellaris
8 /10
8.6 /10
Released
May 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Violent References, Mild Language
Powered by

Stellaris was the first time Paradox Interactive developed a grand strategy game in a fictional world. The sci-fi trappings of this game, coupled with some surprisingly fun role-playing elements, ensure that this game of intergalactic dominance will be a blast for fans to engage with.

Slowly learning the ropes via a well-structured beginning is way easier than fans would assume and makes Stellaris one of the best beginner-friendly grand strategy games. As things start becoming more complex, players should have the patience and knowledge needed to move past the game's challenging moments.

Sid Meier's Civilization 6

It Will Take A While For Civilization 7 To Match This Title's Quality

Sid Meier's Civilization 6
13
9.0 /10
Released
October 21, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Drug Reference, Language, Mild Violence, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Civilization 7 has experienced a rough launch, and it will likely take a while for this game to reach the same heights as its predecessors. Even if players may be disappointed right now, they can still return to Civilization 6 to enjoy this series at its very best.

The sheer amount of content in this game is impressive, allowing players to control different leaders and turn their nation into a superpower everyone will fear. The immense variety of difficulty options ensures that players can ease themselves into the experience before they decide to truly challenge themselves.

Crusader Kings 3

Role-Playing Elements Make This Game Riveting

8 Images
8 Images
Crusader Kings 3
12
8.7 /10
Released
September 1, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teens: Drug Reference, Language, Mild Violence, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Crusader Kings 3 burst onto the scene as one of the best and most approachable grand strategy games in the genre. A huge reason for this stems from a great tutorial and ingenious tooltips to give players the information drip they need to understand how this game works.

What really helps Crusader Kings 3 shine is its excellent role-playing, which has no business being so engaging. Players must make decisions in line with their character's personality or risk Stress buildup, which can lead to severe negative repercussions later down the line.
